content.description: Start two hands on the lowest jug with a fun invert left toe hook and right foot lower down. Do some fun moves on good holds and finish at the lip, to the right of the slopey pocket. Hardest part is not dabbing, though the deadpoint to the pinch/3 finger edge is pretty hard too. Avoid grabbing the lip early, if you do, it is easier.
content.location: So far the only problem on The Clearing Boulder.

content.description: Kind of a long hike to small boulder, but if it has been raining in Red Rocks and you just have to climb outside then it's worth checking out. The granite here will hold up better than the sandstone at Red Rocks. The boulder only has one problem on it at the moment and there's not much potential for more, but the problem it does have is pretty good compared to the rest of the canyon. Besides the hot springs are fairly nearby from here so if you're headed there and have a pad, might as well check it out.
